item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Tuesday, December 31, 2024 at 6:20 AM UTC
item.description:
1. I keep turning my Google Sheets into phone-friendly webapps (240 points | 75 comments)
2. Coconut by Meta AI – Better LLM Reasoning with Chain of Continuous Thought? (100 points | 23 comments)
3. I wrote a Game Boy Advance game in Zig (129 points | 40 comments)
4. "A Course of Pure Mathematics" – G. H. Hardy (1921) [pdf] (164 points | 35 comments)
5. Dumping Memory to Bypass BitLocker on Windows 11 (228 points | 138 comments)
6. Ruby-refrigerator: Freeze all core Ruby classes (18 points | 1 comment)
7. BYD is automaker with the most R&D staff in the world (51 points | 39 comments)
8. Cook: Colliding with the SHA prefix of Linux's initial Git commit (66 points | 15 comments)
9. T2x – a CLI tool for AI-first text operations (17 points | 4 comments)
10. Lightstorm: Minimalistic Ruby Compiler (62 points | 11 comments)
11. Orbit by Mozilla (160 points | 162 comments)
12. Learning Solver Design: Automating Factorio Balancers (167 points | 23 comments)
13. More telcos confirm Salt Typhoon breaches as White House weighs in (111 points | 65 comments)
14. What Happens to Relicensed Open Source Projects and Their Forks? (4 points | 1 comment)
15. Reverse Engineering the Duco Connectivity Board (18 points | 2 comments)
16. Beyond Gradient Averaging in Parallel Optimization (65 points | 19 comments)
17. Curl-Impersonate (382 points | 96 comments)
18. Jack Elam and the Fly in 'Once Upon a Time in the West' (75 points | 13 comments)
19. 'Obelisks': New class of life has been found in human digestive system (384 points | 120 comments)
20. I made a tiny library for switches and sum types in Lua (36 points | 3 comments)
21. Behind the Scenes: Alien Worlds – Jumpship over a tidally locked planet (43 points | 1 comment)
22. Tell HN: John Friel my father, internet pioneer and creator of QModem, has died (880 points | 75 comments)
23. LineageOS 22 Released (112 points | 34 comments)
24. Coding Font Selection 'Tournament' (61 points | 48 comments)
25. Short Message Compression Using LLMs (186 points | 91 comments)
26. Experimenting with architectures for video games inspired by tabletop games (9 points | discuss)
27. Execution units are often pipelined (150 points | 78 comments)
28. Performance of LLMs on Advent of Code 2024 (68 points | 34 comments)
29. The Homa Network Protocol (78 points | 12 comments)
30. MiceWine – run Windows applications and games on Android smartphones (178 points | 55 comments)
item.guid: Hacker News Top Stories: Tuesday, December 31, 2024 at 6:20 AM UTC
